displayName.text: Deep Parikh, MD - Uveitis Specialist, Retina Specialist

formattedAddress: 218 2nd Ave St 402, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 218 2nd Ave St 402, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text:
It was indeed a lucky chance that I came to Dr.Deep Parikh for the treatment of uveitis. When I came in to his clinic, I was in severe pain and my vision was affected and with the help of Dr.Parikh's treatment ,Iam on the way to recovery.
While other doctors I had seen before him had scared me, Dr.Parikh diagnosed correctly and started me on a good treatment plan and gave me the confidence which I needed.
Appreciate his front office and schedulers for understanding my situation and enabling me to get his appointment at a short notice.
I would recommend him to anyone having Uveitis.

originalText.text: I was a first time patient of Dr. Deep Parikh’s. It was an absolutely wonderful experience he is kind, thorough, and informative. He spends time with you to make sure you fully understand your plan of care. He was an absolute delight to visit with as was the rest of his office staff. If you’re in the market for a specialist in his field I highly recommend you consider him for your care.

originalText.text: I visited Dr Parikh due to some concerns I had with my sight. He took the time to address all my concerns and made a very detailed report to share with my primary care physician. The office has many patients and I had to wait for almost an hour but it was worth it.

originalText.text:
After consulting with 4 ophthalmologists to explain my sudden onset of blurry vision, I was fortunate enough to have been referred to Dr Deep Parikh, a Harvard trained super specialist with expertise in lesser known retinal conditions.
He had treated several patients with what I was found to have …a rare and under diagnosed inflammatory syndrome  called TINU involving the eye ( uveitis) and the kidney.
With the proper blood work up and care of a nephrologist, I am hopefully on my way to recovery.
Dr Parikh was quick to recognize my situation since he had treated others with this rare syndrome often associated with an autoimmune disease.
Very few practitioners have ever even heard of TINU and so I am grateful to be under his care.
The staff at Gentile Retina is friendly and accommodating as well….always a plus!
